title: HAIM's 'Something to Tell You' is a Delightful Pop Album
summary: The album is full of catchy tunes, strong harmonies and lots of optimism. If you’re looking for a new album to add to your collection, you should definitely give HAIM’s 'Something to Tell You' a listen. The lyrics and harmonies are smooth and soft, with a subtle beat behind it. The song is about being in love and being certain that the person you're with is the person that you want and need in your life. It's about wanting everything and nothing at the same time.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s been almost three years since we heard new music from HAIM, the sister trio from Calabasas that burst onto the music scene in 2014 with their debut album \u2018Days Are Gone.\u2019
With their sophomore album, \u2018Something to Tell You,\u2019 HAIM continues to be optimistic and uplifting with their new music. The album is a mix of upbeat pop tracks and slower ballads that showcase the sisters\u2019 harmony and vocals. Even if you aren't a fan of pop music, it's worth giving this album a listen.
The trio had been working on this album for some time before releasing it. In September 2016, they released three singles; \u201CRight Now,\u201D \u201CNew York Excuse\u201D and \u201CSentimentality.\u201D
And after a year-long hiatus following the release of these songs, HAIM announced via Instagram in June 2017 that they would finally be releasing their second studio album (and first extended play) later that year.
Luckily for us, they stuck to their word and released the nine-track EP on Sept. 14, just in time for our listening pleasure. Here are some of our favorite tracks from HAIM's 'Something To Tell You' Album:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Something to Tell You"),mdx("p",null,"This song is the perfect introduction to HAIM\u2019s new EP. The lyrics and harmonies are smooth and soft, with a subtle beat behind it. The song is about being in love and being certain that the person you\u2019re with is the person you want and need in your life."),mdx("h2",null,"Want You Back"),mdx("p",null,"This song is reminiscent of HAIM\u2019s first album, \u2018Days Are Gone.\u2019 It\u2019s a blend of synth pop, R&B and a little bit of rock and roll. This song is about wanting someone who has left to come back. It\u2019s about hoping that the person you love is missing you and wants you back in their life and in their heart."),mdx("h2",null,"Little of Your Love"),mdx("p",null,"This is another slower track from the album, featuring the lyrics \u201CI need a little of your love/ I don\u2019t need everything you\u2019ve got/ I just need a little of your love.\u201D The song is about needing someone in your life and only wanting a little of their love, as opposed to needing everything they have. It\u2019s about wanting everything and nothing at the same time."),mdx("h2",null,"Ready for You"),mdx("p",null,"This is one of the more upbeat songs on the album and the first single released before the EP was released. The lyrics are extremely catchy and easy to memorize, even after only listening to it once. This song is about being ready for the person you love and being ready to be with them and commit to them. It\u2019s about knowing that you\u2019re ready for that special person in your life."),mdx("h2",null,"Running For Your Life"),mdx("p",null,"This is another slower track from the album that has a more R&B vibe. This is a passionate track about not being ready to commit to someone and wanting to run from them. The song is from the point of view of someone who is not ready to fully commit to another person and is running from them."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Give up Your Daydream"),mdx("p",null,"This upbeat track is the last song on the album. It\u2019s about not being ready to give up your dreams and to keep going even if you\u2019ve hit a few bumps along the way. It\u2019s about staying optimistic even when things aren\u2019t going as planned. This is a great message to send out to all the smudges out there. Keep fighting and don\u2019t give up!"),mdx("h2",null,"Together"),mdx("p",null,"This is the last track on the album (and the first track on the album that isn\u2019t a full-length song). It\u2019s a beautiful track about staying optimistic and being with someone who you love. It\u2019s about finding the person you love and being with them even when everything else seems to be going wrong."),mdx("h2",null,"Through It All"),mdx("p",null,"This is another slower track from the album. It\u2019s about being in a relationship and going through everything together. It\u2019s about being with someone who you love and being with them through good times and bad."),mdx("h2",null,"Epilogue: Yearning"),mdx("p",null,`This is the last song on the album. It\u2019s about wanting someone and knowing that you\u2019re not ready for a relationship. It\u2019s about being drawn to someone but not being able to be with them because you aren\u2019t ready to fully commit. What to expect?
This album is full of catchy tunes, strong harmonies and lots of optimism. If you\u2019re looking for a new album to add to your collection, you should definitely give HAIM\u2019s 'Something to Tell You' a listen.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Big Short" Is a Searing Indictment of the Financial Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The film version of The Big Short hits theaters this Friday, and it\u2019s not subtle. Its tagline is \u201CThere\u2019s a sucker born every minute. But they don\u2019t grow up thinking they can be con men. They get taught to be one.\u201D And its trailer goes on to say, \u201CThe housing bubble was about to burst\u2026 And a group of misfits saw it coming. Now these unlikely heroes must band together and bring down the greedy villains who crashed the world economy\u2026 Before anyone else gets hurt.\u201D
Unfortunately, that last part is not hyperbole. The actions of unscrupulous financial engineers \u2014 colloquially known as \u201Cbankers\u201D \u2014 led directly to the Great Recession in 2008, which cost millions their jobs and homes, while triggering widespread deflation and anemic growth throughout much of the developed world for years thereafter.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Death Cab for Cutie's 'Thank You for Today' Is a Delight

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thank You for Today is the sixth album from Seattle indie rockers Death Cab for Cutie. Released on August 31, 2018, it\u2019s also the band\u2019s final record with their original label Atlantic Records. After two decades in the music business, Death Cab for Cutie have developed into one of the most beloved bands in indie rock.
After their last album, Codes and Keys (2012), frontman Ben Gibbard announced that he was working on a solo project called The New Age. It was something he had been thinking about for some time but wasn\u2019t sure when or if it would come to fruition. Fortunately, after meeting with producer Rich Costey (M83, Blond Redhead) who helped him record some demos, things fell into place. The album came out as a collaborative release between Ben Gibbard and Nathan Wiley under the name The Further Adventures of New Age. And three years later Death Cab For Cutie released Thank You For Today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Beach House's '7' Is a Dreamy Masterpiece
"Boyhood" Is a Coming-Of-Age Story like No Other

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The coming-of-age trope is one of the most frequently used narrative devices in modern film. From "Stand by Me" to "Superbad," there are countless stories about adolescents transitioning from innocent children into independent adults. However, it is almost unheard of for a film to capture the nuances and absurdities of growing up as effectively as Richard Linklater\u2019s \u201CBoyhood.\u201D The movie documents 12 years in the life of Mason (played by Ellar Coltrane) and his family through a series of carefully crafted vignettes that document the everyday minutiae of life without being clich\xE9 or cloying.
Like so many movies about kids growing up, "Boyhood" begins with young Mason being uprooted from his home in Texas and forced to migrate to new cities as he grows older. What makes this movie unique, however, is that all these major events occur over an 11-year period while Linklater was filming with the same actors at different points in their lives. The result is something like a documentary on human development \u2014 funny, sad, awkward, and everything in between \u2014 presented through the lens of an intimate cinematic experience.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Bts's 'Love Yourself: Tear' Is a Triumph

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In a world where every band is a boy band, BTS stands out. The Korean sextet has made a name for itself as not just another boy band but one that plays its own instruments and has choreographed dance routines that are so intricate they sometimes require special stage lighting.
Armed with these weapons, BTS has twice cracked the top 10 on the Billboard 200 album chart with its Love Yourself series. And the latest installment of this series \u2014 which doubles as its sixth EP \u2014 is no exception.
Furthermore, it\u2019s the strongest of the bunch.
It\u2019s impossible to talk about BTS without mentioning their massive following beyond Korea: Vivid, obsessive ARMYs (as they call them) who follow their every move and buy everything associated with them. This is why many people assume they are only famous because of social media and pandering ads (which is true). However, anyone who listens to their music will tell you that they deserve all this success. \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D proves it once again.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: A-Trak's 'in My Feelings' Is a Summer Bop You Need in Your Life
"The Babadook" Is a Haunting and Original Horror Film
Father John Misty's 'Pure Comedy' Is a Hilarious Masterpiece
Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' Is a Solid Effort

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Charlie Puth has been on a roll lately, with three top 40 hits in the last two years. He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
